task.name: hifa_bandpassflag
task.description:
This task performs a preliminary phased-up bandpass solution and temporarily applies it, then computes the flagging heuristics by calling hif_correctedampflag which looks for outlier visibility points by statistically examining the scalar difference of the corrected amplitudes minus model amplitudes, and then flags those outliers. The philosophy is that only outlier data points that have remained outliers after calibration will be flagged. Note that the phase of the data is not assessed.
Plots are generated at two points in this workflow: after bandpass calibration but before flagging heuristics are run, and after flagging heuristics have been run and applied. If no points were flagged, the 'after' plots are not generated or displayed.
If pipeline mode is 'getinputs' then None is returned. Otherwise the results object for the pipeline task is returned.

param.name: vis
param.description:
List of input MeasurementSets. Defaults to the list of MeasurementSets specified in the pipeline context.
Example: vis=['ngc5921.ms']

param.name: caltable
param.description:
List of names for the output calibration tables. Defaults to the standard pipeline naming convention.
Example: caltable=['ngc5921.gcal']

param.name: intent
param.shortdescription: List of intents to use in data selection
param.description:
A string containing a comma delimited list of intents against which the selected fields are matched. Set to intent='' by default, which means the task will select all data with the BANDPASS intent.
Example: intent='*PHASE*'

param.name: field
param.shortdescription: List of field names or ids to use in data selection
param.description:
The list of field names or field ids for which bandpasses are computed. Set to field='' by default, which means the task will select all fields.
Example: field='3C279', field='3C279,M82'

param.name: spw
param.shortdescription: List of spectral windows to use in data selection
param.description:
The list of spectral windows and channels for which bandpasses are computed. Set to spw='' by default, which means the task will select all science spectral windows.
Example: spw='11,13,15,17'

param.name: antenna
param.description: Set of data selection antenna IDs

param.name: hm_phaseup
param.description:
The pre-bandpass solution phaseup gain heuristics. The options are: 'snr': compute solution required to achieve the specified SNR 'manual': use manual solution parameters '': skip phaseup
Example: hm_phaseup='manual'

param.name: phaseupsolint
param.description:
The phase correction solution interval in CASA syntax. Used when hm_phaseup='manual' or as a default if the hm_phaseup='snr' heuristic computation fails.
Example: phaseupsolint='300s'

param.name: phaseupbw
param.description:
Bandwidth to be used for phaseup. Used when hm_phaseup='manual'.
Example: phaseupbw='' to use entire bandpass phaseupbw='500MHz' to use central 500MHz

param.name: phaseupsnr
param.description:
The required SNR for the phaseup solution. Used only if hm_phaseup='snr'.
Example: phaseupsnr=10.0

param.name: phaseupnsols
param.shortdescription: Minimum number of phaseup gain solutions
param.description:
The minimum number of phaseup gain solutions. Used only if hm_phaseup='snr'.
Example: phaseupnsols=4

param.name: hm_bandpass
param.description: The bandpass solution heuristics. The options are: 'snr': compute the solution required to achieve the specified SNR 'smoothed': simple smoothing heuristics 'fixed': use the user defined parameters for all spws

param.name: solint
param.description:
Time and channel solution intervals in CASA syntax.
Default is solint='inf', which is used when hm_bandpass='fixed'. If hm_bandpass is set to 'snr', then the task will attempt to compute and use an optimal SNR-based solint (and warn if this solint is not good enough). If hm_bandpass is set to 'smoothed', the task will use a smoothed solint.

param.name: maxchannels
param.description:
The bandpass solution smoothing factor in channels. The solution interval is bandwidth / 240. Set to 0 for no smoothing. Used if hm_bandpass='smoothed'.
Example: maxchannels=0

param.name: evenbpints
param.shortdescription: Force frequency solint to even bandpass intervals
param.description:
Force the per spw frequency solint to be evenly divisible into the spw bandpass if hm_bandpass='snr'.
Example: evenbpints=False

param.name: bpsnr
param.description:
The required SNR for the bandpass solution. Used only if hm_bandpass='snr'.
Example: bpsnr=30.0

param.name: minbpsnr
param.shortdescription: Minimum SNR for bandpass frequency solution when strong atmospheric lines exist in Tsys spectra
param.description:
The minimum required SNR for the bandpass solution when strong atmospheric lines exist in Tsys spectra. Used only if hm_bandpass='snr'.
Example: minbpsnr=10.0

param.name: bpnsols
param.description: The minimum number of bandpass solutions. Used only if hm_bandpass='snr'.

param.name: combine
param.shortdescription: Data axes which to combine for solve (scan, spw, and/or field)
param.description:
Data axes to combine for solving. Axes are '', 'scan', 'spw', 'field' or any comma-separated combination.
Example: combine='scan,field'

param.name: refant
param.description:
List of reference antenna names. Defaults to the value(s) stored in the pipeline context. If undefined in the pipeline context defaults to the CASA reference antenna naming scheme.
Example: refant='DV06,DV07'

param.name: minblperant
param.shortdescription: Minimum baselines per antenna required for solve
param.description: Minimum number of baselines required per antenna for each solve. Antennas with fewer baselines are excluded from solutions.

param.name: minsnr
param.description: Solutions below this SNR are rejected

param.name: solnorm
param.description: Normalise the bandpass solution

param.name: antnegsig
param.description: Lower sigma threshold for identifying outliers as a result of bad antennas within individual timestamps.

param.name: antpossig
param.description: Upper sigma threshold for identifying outliers as a result of bad antennas within individual timestamps.

param.name: tmantint
param.description: Threshold for maximum fraction of timestamps that are allowed to contain outliers.

param.name: tmint
param.description: Initial threshold for maximum fraction of 'outlier timestamps' over 'total timestamps' that a baseline may be a part of.

param.name: tmbl
param.description: Initial threshold for maximum fraction of 'bad baselines' over 'all baselines' that an antenna may be a part of.

param.name: antblnegsig
param.description: Lower sigma threshold for identifying outliers as a result of 'bad baselines' and/or 'bad antennas' within baselines (across all timestamps).

param.name: antblpossig
param.description: Upper sigma threshold for identifying outliers as a result of 'bad baselines' and/or 'bad antennas' within baselines (across all timestamps).

param.name: relaxed_factor
param.description: Relaxed value to set the threshold scaling factor to under certain conditions (see task description).

param.name: niter
param.shortdescription: Maximum number of times to iterate on evaluation of flagging heuristics.
param.description: Maximum number of times to iterate on evaluation of flagging heuristics. If an iteration results in no new flags, then subsequent iterations are skipped.

param.name: pipelinemode
param.description: The pipeline operating mode. In 'automatic' mode the pipeline determines the values of all context defined pipeline inputs automatically. In interactive mode the user can set the pipeline context defined parameters manually. In 'getinputs' mode the user can check the settings of all pipeline parameters without running the task.

param.name: dryrun
param.shortdescription: Run the task (False) or list commands (True)
param.description: Run the commands (True) or generate the commands to be run but do not execute (False).

param.name: acceptresults
param.description: Automatically accept the results of the task into the pipeline context (True) or reject them (False).
